comments:
Occurs when the model for a project cannot be found (when there is a problem with a plugin).  Will attach a patch.

Created an attachment (id=79651)
Possible Fix

If there is a problem in the manifest file, the bundle description cannot be retrieved.  Patch throws a core exception if this occurs and passes the exception up the stack.

Thanks Curtis for finding this bug then fixing it right away.  You waste no time :)

We rely on the BundleDescription in a couple other areas in PDE (one being validation).  It is current practice that since BundleDescriptions are implementation details, that we don't publicize its existence at all.  Our ever improving validation is trying to catch more and more scenarios when a BundleDescription can't be created due to invalid data.  Since odds are the user will already see an error on their Manifest, I think logging the exception is unnecessary.

Made a slight modification to return an empty array if no BundleDescription can be found for the model.

Good catch on this one!
Reopening to assign it to the person to who fixed the bug, Curtis :)
Marking it as fixed again after updating assignee.
